intro: Acer negundo f. auratum, commonly known as the golden ash, is a variant of the ash tree characterized by its striking golden-yellow foliage. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows in temperate climates, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a serrated margin, turning vibrant shades of yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in the spring, followed by samaras that disperse its seeds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in gardens and parks.
